faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to the most frequently asked questions about HomeCheff. Can't find your question? Contact us!
faq.contactDescription: Our customer service is happy to help. We usually respond within 24 hours.

0.question: What is HomeCheff?
0.answer:
HomeCheff is a local platform where individuals can sell their handmade products. We focus on homemade dishes, fresh products from your own garden, and handmade creations. The platform connects local makers with consumers in their neighborhood.

üéØ Our mission: Reducing food waste by sharing surplus meals and products. If you cook for yourself and have too much, you can share it with others in your neighborhood. This contributes to a more sustainable and social community.

üí∞ PRACTICAL BENEFITS:
‚Ä¢ Extra income to fund your hobby
‚Ä¢ Deduct expenses from your revenue
‚Ä¢ Annual vacation (max ‚Ç¨2000)
‚Ä¢ Monthly supplement to benefits possible
‚Ä¢ Fund renovations or extras

1.question: How does HomeCheff work?
1.answer:
For private sellers, the platform is completely free! You only pay transaction fees so the app can continue to exist. Companies with a KVK number can choose a subscription. Buyers can search, filter, and buy local products.

ü§ù COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Connect local makers and buyers
‚Ä¢ Reduce waste through sharing
‚Ä¢ Support handmade products
‚Ä¢ Stimulate conscious consumption

2.question: Is HomeCheff free to use?
2.answer: Yes! For private sellers, HomeCheff is completely free. You pay no monthly costs, only transaction fees on each sale. For companies with a KVK number, subscriptions are available.

3.question: In which cities is HomeCheff available?
3.answer: HomeCheff is currently available throughout the Netherlands. We focus on local communities and gradually expand to more regions.

4.question: How can I contact HomeCheff?
4.answer: You can reach us via support@homecheff.eu, our helpdesk in the app, or via the contact page. We usually respond within 24 hours.

5.question: Can I earn extra income alongside my benefits?
5.answer:
Yes, you can earn extra income alongside your benefits, but there are rules:

üí∞ BENEFITS AND EXTRA INCOME:
‚Ä¢ Wajong: 70% of your income is deducted from your benefits
‚Ä¢ Social assistance: You can keep part of your income
‚Ä¢ All income must be reported to the UWV within 1 week

üí° PRACTICAL TIPS:
‚Ä¢ Keep track of your expenses for deduction from your revenue
‚Ä¢ Consult with the UWV about your specific situation
‚Ä¢ Use your hobby to generate extra income
‚Ä¢ Take advantage of available exemptions

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: Always contact the UWV before you start selling! HomeCheff is only a platform and does not provide tax or benefits advice.

6.question: What is HomeCheff's liability?
6.answer:
‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT LEGAL INFORMATION:

HomeCheff is only a platform that connects sellers and buyers. We are NOT responsible for:
‚Ä¢ Product quality
‚Ä¢ Disputes between sellers and buyers
‚Ä¢ Damage from products
‚Ä¢ Loss or theft during delivery
‚Ä¢ User tax returns
‚Ä¢ Benefits arrangements

All transactions are between seller and buyer. HomeCheff only mediates in disputes but is not liable for the outcome.

By using HomeCheff, you agree to these terms.

0.question: How do I become a seller on HomeCheff?
0.answer:
Register your account, choose a seller role (Chef, Garden, Designer), and fill in your bank details. For individuals, no subscription is needed - you can start selling immediately! Small businesses can optionally choose a subscription for favorable rates.

ü§ù LOCAL COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Focus on reducing waste
‚Ä¢ Reuse materials and ingredients
‚Ä¢ Share your handmade story
‚Ä¢ Inspire others to consume consciously

1.question: What subscriptions are available for sellers?
1.answer:
For individuals: Completely free! You only pay transaction fees.

For small businesses, optional subscriptions are available with different rates. You can always upgrade or downgrade to another subscription.

ü§ù LOCAL COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ No extra costs for handmade products
‚Ä¢ Support for local makers
‚Ä¢ Reward for reducing waste

For specific prices and rates, you can log into your account and go to the subscription section.

2.question: What can I sell on HomeCheff?
2.answer:
Only handmade products of your own making that reduce waste:

üç≥ CHEF (Local cooking):
‚Ä¢ Homemade dishes from local ingredients
‚Ä¢ Surplus meals to reduce waste
‚Ä¢ Seasonal dishes
‚Ä¢ Reuse leftovers and ingredients

üå± GARDEN (Local gardening):
‚Ä¢ Self-grown vegetables, fruits, herbs
‚Ä¢ Share surplus harvest
‚Ä¢ Seeds and cuttings from your own plants
‚Ä¢ Support local biodiversity

üé® DESIGNER (Handmade creating):
‚Ä¢ Upcycled and recycled items
‚Ä¢ Handmade art from leftover materials
‚Ä¢ Restored and refurbished items
‚Ä¢ Use local materials

ü§ù No trade or resale of factory products. All products must contribute to the local community.

3.question: How do I get my money paid out?
3.answer:
Payouts happen automatically via Stripe Connect to your specified bank account. For new accounts, the payout period is 7 days after payment. As your account gets older and builds a positive history, payouts can become faster (2-3 business days).

üí∞ PRACTICAL BENEFITS:
‚Ä¢ Faster payout for handmade products
‚Ä¢ Extra reward for reducing waste
‚Ä¢ Transparent costs for local makers
‚Ä¢ Deduct expenses from your revenue

You will receive an email when the payout is processed.

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: HomeCheff is only a platform. We are not responsible for product quality or disputes between sellers and buyers.

4.question: How can I sell effectively on HomeCheff?
4.answer:
Focus on handmade quality and reducing waste:

‚ôªÔ∏è AGAINST WASTE:
‚Ä¢ Reuse materials and ingredients
‚Ä¢ Repair and upcycle old items
‚Ä¢ Share surplus products
‚Ä¢ Mention how you reduce waste

üåø LOCAL PRACTICES:
‚Ä¢ Use local and seasonal ingredients
‚Ä¢ Minimize packaging materials
‚Ä¢ Choose local materials
‚Ä¢ Inspire others to live consciously

ü§ù COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Share your handmade story
‚Ä¢ Teach others how to upcycle
‚Ä¢ Build a conscious sales culture

5.question: Can I edit or delete my products?
5.answer:
Yes, you can always edit your products, adjust stock, change prices, or temporarily deactivate products. Deletion is also possible, but this affects your statistics.

ü§ù LOCAL COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Update handmade product information
‚Ä¢ Add new local aspects
‚Ä¢ Adjust packaging information
‚Ä¢ Share updates about your waste reduction initiatives

6.question: How can I offer future products?
6.answer:
HomeCheff's reservation system helps you reduce waste by planning ahead:

üìÖ FUTURE AVAILABILITY:
‚Ä¢ Offer products up to 1 week in advance
‚Ä¢ Perfect for when you know you'll make too much
‚Ä¢ Let buyers reserve in advance
‚Ä¢ Prevent waste through planning

üéØ EXAMPLES:
‚Ä¢ BBQ weekend: 'Extra hamburgers - reserve in advance'
‚Ä¢ Party: 'Cake too big for our family'
‚Ä¢ Cooking day: 'Extra pasta portions - 3 days ahead'

‚ôªÔ∏è BENEFITS:
‚Ä¢ You know exactly how much to make
‚Ä¢ No more food waste
‚Ä¢ Buyers can plan
‚Ä¢ Better earnings through planning

üí° TIP: If you know you always make too much, offer it in advance!

0.question: How do I buy products on HomeCheff?
0.answer:
Search for handmade products, view product information, add to cart, and go to checkout. Payment is processed via Stripe (secure and fast). After payment, you'll receive confirmation and seller contact details.

ü§ù LOCAL COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Choose local and seasonal products
‚Ä¢ Support handmade creations
‚Ä¢ Prevent waste by buying locally
‚Ä¢ Connect with makers in your neighborhood

1.question: What payment methods are accepted?
1.answer:
We accept all major payment methods via Stripe: iDEAL, credit cards, Bancontact, SEPA, and more. All payments are secured and encrypted.

ü§ù LOCAL COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Electronic payments support local makers
‚Ä¢ No cash = safer for community
‚Ä¢ Digital receipts are more practical
‚Ä¢ Transparent costs for handmade products

2.question: Can I reserve products?
2.answer:
Yes! HomeCheff offers a unique reservation system for future products. This is perfect for BBQs, parties, or special occasions.

üìÖ FUTURE AVAILABILITY:
‚Ä¢ Products can be offered up to 1 week in advance
‚Ä¢ Reserve in advance to prevent waste
‚Ä¢ Sellers know exactly how much to make
‚Ä¢ Ideal for surplus meals

‚ôªÔ∏è AGAINST WASTE:
‚Ä¢ Prevents waste through planning
‚Ä¢ Fewer impulse purchases
‚Ä¢ Better inventory management for sellers
‚Ä¢ Less food waste

üí° EXAMPLE: Planning a BBQ weekend? Offer your surplus portions in advance and let people reserve!

3.question: What if I'm not satisfied with my purchase?
3.answer:
First contact the seller. If that doesn't work, we can mediate. We have a complaint procedure and can arrange a refund in extreme cases.

‚ôªÔ∏è AGAINST WASTE:
‚Ä¢ Reuse products where possible
‚Ä¢ Composting of organic products
‚Ä¢ Feedback for improvement
‚Ä¢ Learn from handmade practices

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: HomeCheff is only a platform. We are not responsible for product quality or disputes between sellers and buyers.

4.question: Can I become a fan of sellers?
4.answer:
Yes! Become a fan of your favorite handmade sellers to stay updated on new products. You'll receive notifications when they add new handmade items.

ü§ù LOCAL COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Support local makers
‚Ä¢ Learn from handmade techniques
‚Ä¢ Share tips and experiences
‚Ä¢ Build a conscious community

5.question: How does future availability and reservations work?
5.answer:
HomeCheff's unique reservation system helps reduce waste through forward planning:

üìÖ FUTURE PRODUCTS:
‚Ä¢ Offer up to 1 week in advance
‚Ä¢ Perfect for BBQs, parties, special occasions
‚Ä¢ Sellers know exactly how much to make
‚Ä¢ Buyers can reserve in advance

üéØ EXAMPLES:
‚Ä¢ 'BBQ weekend - reserve your portion' (3 days ahead)
‚Ä¢ 'Extra cake for birthday' (1 week ahead)
‚Ä¢ 'Surplus pasta tonight' (today)

‚ôªÔ∏è BENEFITS:
‚Ä¢ Prevents food waste
‚Ä¢ Better planning for sellers
‚Ä¢ Buyers know what to expect
‚Ä¢ Fewer impulse purchases

üí° TIP: If you know you'll make too much, offer it in advance!

0.question: Are payments secure on HomeCheff?
0.answer: Yes, all payments are processed via Stripe, one of the world's most secure payment providers. Your banking details are never stored on our servers.

1.question: When is my money debited?
1.answer: Payments are debited immediately when you complete your order. For subscriptions, monthly automatic collection applies.

2.question: Can I cancel a payment?
2.answer: Payments can only be canceled before the transaction is completed. After completion, you must contact the seller or our customer service.

3.question: What are the transaction fees?
3.answer: Transaction fees vary by subscription type. These costs are automatically deducted from your sales revenue. For exact rates, log into your account and go to the subscription section.

4.question: Can I track my payouts?
4.answer:
Yes, you can track your payouts in your seller dashboard. There you'll see all transactions, payouts, and costs clearly together.

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: HomeCheff is only a platform. We are not responsible for product quality or disputes between sellers and buyers.

0.question: How does delivery work on HomeCheff?
0.answer:
Sellers can choose pickup, delivery, or both. For delivery, seller and buyer arrange details among themselves. HomeCheff does not mediate in the delivery itself.

ü§ù LOCAL COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Local delivery supports the neighborhood
‚Ä¢ Bike delivery is more practical
‚Ä¢ Pickup prevents extra packaging
‚Ä¢ Combined delivery is more efficient

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: HomeCheff is only a platform. We are not responsible for delivery or disputes between sellers and buyers.

1.question: What are the delivery costs?
1.answer: Delivery costs are determined by the seller and are visible for each product. Some sellers offer free delivery from a certain amount.

2.question: Can I have my order delivered?
2.answer: That depends on the seller. Some only offer pickup, others also delivery. Check the product page for delivery options and contact the seller.

3.question: What if my order doesn't arrive?
3.answer: Contact the seller immediately. If that doesn't work, we can mediate. Keep your payment proof for any claims.

4.question: Can I pick up an order?
4.answer: Yes, if the seller offers pickup. You'll receive the address and pickup time after your order. Make sure to bring your payment proof.

5.question: How do I become a deliverer on HomeCheff?
5.answer:
Deliverers can sign up via /delivery/signup. You must be between 15-23 years old, have a valid ID, and agree to our terms. Minors need parental consent.

ü§ù LOCAL COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Bike delivery is preferred
‚Ä¢ Local routes support the neighborhood
‚Ä¢ Combined delivery is more efficient
‚Ä¢ Use reusable packaging

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: As a deliverer, you are a self-employed entrepreneur. HomeCheff is only a platform and not your employer.

6.question: What do I earn as a deliverer?
6.answer:
You earn per delivery. The exact amount depends on distance and complexity. You are a self-employed entrepreneur and are responsible for taxes and insurance.

üí∞ PRACTICAL BENEFITS:
‚Ä¢ Extra reward for bike delivery
‚Ä¢ Bonus for combined routes
‚Ä¢ Reward for reusable packaging
‚Ä¢ Incentive for local delivery

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: HomeCheff is only a platform. We are not your employer and do not provide employer insurance.

7.question: What insurance do I need as a deliverer?
7.answer: You are required to take out liability insurance (min. ‚Ç¨1,000,000) and accident insurance. You must also insure your vehicle. HomeCheff does not provide employer insurance.

8.question: How does payment work for deliverers?
8.answer: Your earnings are automatically paid out via the platform. You are responsible for reporting your income to the tax authorities and paying taxes.

9.question: Can I set my own working hours as a deliverer?
9.answer: Yes, as a self-employed deliverer, you decide when you're available. You can set your availability in your deliverer dashboard and accept or decline deliveries.

10.question: What if something goes wrong during a delivery?
10.answer: As a deliverer, you are responsible for damage or problems during delivery. Ensure adequate insurance. For serious incidents, you can contact our support.

11.question: How is my location used as a deliverer?
11.answer: We only use your location to match you with nearby deliveries and optimize the route. Your location is not shared with third parties and is not stored after delivery.

0.question: Do I have to pay taxes on my sales?
0.answer: Yes, as a seller, you are responsible for reporting all income to the tax authorities. There is no minimum amount - all income must be reported.

1.question: From what amount do I have to pay VAT?
1.answer: You are VAT-liable from ‚Ç¨20,000 revenue per year. Below this amount, you don't have to pay VAT, but you must report your income for income tax.

2.question: Does HomeCheff share my data with the tax authorities?
2.answer: Yes, according to EU directive DAC7, we are required to share your data if you perform more than 30 transactions per year or achieve more than ‚Ç¨2,000 revenue.

3.question: Do I need to register with the Chamber of Commerce?
3.answer: For structural sales (regular selling), you must register with the Chamber of Commerce. For occasional sales, this is usually not necessary.

4.question: Does HomeCheff provide tax advice?
4.answer: No, HomeCheff does not provide tax advice. Consult an accountant or tax advisor for specific questions about your situation.

0.question: What does 'handmade' mean on HomeCheff?
0.answer: Handmade means you made, grew, or prepared the product yourself with sustainability in mind. It's about reusing materials, reducing waste, and creating unique, sustainable products. We encourage creativity that contributes to a circular economy.

1.question: Can I fix up old items and sell them?
1.answer:
Yes, that's great! Restoring and upcycling old items is a beautiful form of sustainability. Think of:

‚ôªÔ∏è UPGRADING ITEMS:
‚Ä¢ Restore and personalize old clothing
‚Ä¢ Refurbish furniture and give it a new look
‚Ä¢ Repair and modernize electronics
‚Ä¢ Restore and improve kitchenware

üå± SUSTAINABILITY:
‚Ä¢ Prevents waste of raw materials
‚Ä¢ Extends product lifespan
‚Ä¢ Reduces waste
‚Ä¢ Creates unique, personal items

üí° Tip: Clearly describe what you've done and why it's sustainable!

2.question: How can I sell sustainable handmade work?
2.answer:
Focus on sustainability and reuse in your products:

üåø SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS:
‚Ä¢ Use scraps and surplus materials
‚Ä¢ Choose organic or recycled ingredients
‚Ä¢ Reuse packaging and containers
‚Ä¢ Turn old items into something new

‚ôªÔ∏è CIRCULAR ECONOMY:
‚Ä¢ Repair instead of throwing away
‚Ä¢ Give old items a second life
‚Ä¢ Mention sustainable aspects in your description
‚Ä¢ Inspire others to live sustainably

ü§ù COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Share your sustainability story
‚Ä¢ Teach others how to upcycle
‚Ä¢ Build a conscious community

3.question: What if I make products from recycled materials?
3.answer:
That's fantastic! Recycled materials are the future of sustainable handmade work:

‚ôªÔ∏è RECYCLED MATERIALS:
‚Ä¢ Transform old clothing into new items
‚Ä¢ Reuse glassware for decoration
‚Ä¢ Process wood from old furniture
‚Ä¢ Convert plastic packaging into art

üå± BENEFITS:
‚Ä¢ Dramatically reduces waste
‚Ä¢ Saves new raw materials
‚Ä¢ Creates unique, storytelling products
‚Ä¢ Inspires more conscious consumption

üí° Tip: Tell the story of your materials - where they come from and how you transformed them!

4.question: How can I package my handmade products sustainably?
4.answer:
Sustainable packaging is an important part of your sustainable approach:

üåø SUSTAINABLE PACKAGING:
‚Ä¢ Reuse old boxes and bags
‚Ä¢ Use biodegradable materials
‚Ä¢ Make your own reusable packaging
‚Ä¢ Choose minimalist, functional packaging

‚ôªÔ∏è CIRCULAR PACKAGING:
‚Ä¢ Packaging that can be reused
‚Ä¢ Embedded seeds in packaging material
‚Ä¢ Compostable packaging
‚Ä¢ No plastic, but natural materials

ü§ù INSPIRE:
‚Ä¢ Show how you package sustainably
‚Ä¢ Give tips for reusing packaging
‚Ä¢ Build a conscious packaging culture

5.question: What are examples of allowed products?
5.answer:
‚úÖ Home-baked cakes, homemade jam, fresh pasta
‚úÖ Self-grown tomatoes, herbs from your own garden
‚úÖ Handmade jewelry, knitted sweaters, paintings
‚ùå Factory cookies, wholesale vegetables, mass-produced clothing

0.question: How do I know sellers are trustworthy?
0.answer:
We have a verification system, reviews from other users, and a complaint procedure. New sellers are extra checked. Always read reviews before buying.

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: HomeCheff is only a platform. We are not responsible for product quality, safety, or disputes. All transactions are between seller and buyer.

1.question: What if I have problems with a seller?
1.answer: First contact the seller. If that doesn't work, you can file a complaint via our helpdesk. We mediate in disputes and can take action in extreme cases.

2.question: Is my personal data secure?
2.answer: Yes, we protect your data according to GDPR. We use encryption, secure servers, and only share your data with third parties when legally required.

3.question: Can I buy anonymously?
3.answer: Your account is needed for transactions, but you can keep your profile private. Sellers only see your name and contact details needed for the transaction.

4.question: What if a product is not as described?
4.answer: Contact the seller for a solution. If that doesn't work, we can mediate. Keep photos and descriptions as evidence.

0.question: How does HomeCheff contribute to reducing food waste?
0.answer:
üå± HomeCheff helps reduce food waste by sharing surplus meals and products. If you cook for yourself and have too much, you can share it with others in your neighborhood. This is not only sustainable but also social - you help others while preventing waste.

üí° Think of: Extra portion of pasta, surplus vegetables from your garden, or a cake that was too big for your family. Instead of throwing away, you share it with your community.

1.question: Does sharing surplus food fall under commercial sales?
1.answer:
‚ùå No, this falls under 'sharing surplus food' and not commercial food production. You cook for yourself and only share what you have left. This is similar to sharing food with neighbors or friends - just via a platform.

‚úÖ You are not a restaurant or commercial kitchen. You simply share your surplus meals to reduce waste.

2.question: Do I need to register with the NVWA if I share surplus food?
2.answer:
‚ùå No, for sharing surplus food, you don't need to register with the NVWA. This only applies to commercial food production. Because you cook for yourself and only share what's left, you don't fall under food inspection laws.

üè† Your kitchen remains a private kitchen, not a commercial kitchen. You simply share your surplus meals with your neighborhood.

3.question: What's the difference between selling and sharing surplus food?
3.answer:
üîÑ The difference is in the intention:

üì§ SHARING (what we do):
‚Ä¢ You cook for yourself
‚Ä¢ You made too much
‚Ä¢ You share the surplus portion
‚Ä¢ Small compensation for ingredients

üí∞ SELLING (commercial):
‚Ä¢ You cook specifically for sale
‚Ä¢ You produce to order
‚Ä¢ You are a commercial kitchen
‚Ä¢ Full profit margin

HomeCheff focuses on the first: sharing surplus food!

4.question: Are there limits to how much I can share?
4.answer:
üìä Yes, to stay under the radar of food inspection:

‚úÖ ALLOWED:
‚Ä¢ Occasional sale of surplus food
‚Ä¢ Small quantities (1-5 portions at a time)
‚Ä¢ Homemade meals
‚Ä¢ Fresh products from your own garden

‚ùå NOT ALLOWED:
‚Ä¢ Large commercial production
‚Ä¢ Daily sale of the same products
‚Ä¢ Professional kitchen setup
‚Ä¢ Mass production

üéØ Stay within the 'sharing' category, not 'selling'!

5.question: How can I safely share surplus food?
5.answer:
üõ°Ô∏è Follow these guidelines for safe sharing:

üçΩÔ∏è HYGIENE:
‚Ä¢ Wash your hands before cooking
‚Ä¢ Use clean kitchen equipment
‚Ä¢ Keep food cool until serving
‚Ä¢ Mention preparation date

üìù TRANSPARENCY:
‚Ä¢ Describe what you made
‚Ä¢ List the ingredients
‚Ä¢ Mention allergens
‚Ä¢ Be honest about freshness

ü§ù COMMUNICATION:
‚Ä¢ Respond quickly to questions
‚Ä¢ Give clear instructions
‚Ä¢ Be friendly and helpful

This builds trust and contributes to a safe community!

6.question: Can I share self-grown vegetables and garden products?
6.answer:
üå± Yes! Sharing surplus vegetables from your own garden falls under the same category as surplus food. You grow for yourself and only share what you have left.

‚úÖ ALLOWED:
‚Ä¢ Surplus tomatoes, cucumbers, lettuce
‚Ä¢ Too many herbs (basil, parsley, thyme)
‚Ä¢ Extra fruit from your fruit trees
‚Ä¢ Flowers and plants you have left
‚Ä¢ Seeds and cuttings from your plants

üè° This is not commercial agriculture - you simply share your garden harvest!

7.question: Does sharing garden products fall under agricultural regulations?
7.answer:
‚ùå No, for sharing surplus garden products, you don't need to register with the NVWA. This only applies to commercial agriculture and food production.

üåø Your situation:
‚Ä¢ Private garden (not a commercial nursery)
‚Ä¢ You grow for yourself
‚Ä¢ You only share what's left
‚Ä¢ No large-scale production

‚úÖ You are not a farmer or grower - you simply share your garden harvest to reduce waste!

8.question: What if I've grown too many plants?
8.answer:
üå± Perfect! Many gardeners like to grow plants but have too many. This is a great way to reduce waste:

üåø SHARING PLANTS:
‚Ä¢ Extra seedlings you have left
‚Ä¢ Cuttings from your favorite plants
‚Ä¢ Bulbs you have too many of
‚Ä¢ Houseplants you want to share

ü§ù COMMUNITY:
‚Ä¢ Help other gardeners
‚Ä¢ Prevent plant waste
‚Ä¢ Support local biodiversity
‚Ä¢ Build a green community

üí° Tip: Many people enjoy growing but don't always have green thumbs - you help them!

9.question: Are there limits to sharing garden products?
9.answer:
üìä Yes, to stay within the 'sharing' category:

‚úÖ ALLOWED (occasional sharing):
‚Ä¢ Small quantities of surplus vegetables
‚Ä¢ A few plants/cuttings at a time
‚Ä¢ Fresh herbs from your garden
‚Ä¢ Flowers you have left
‚Ä¢ Seeds from your own plants

‚ùå NOT ALLOWED (commercial production):
‚Ä¢ Large quantities of the same vegetable
‚Ä¢ Daily sale of garden products
‚Ä¢ Professional nursery setup
‚Ä¢ Mass production of plants

üéØ Stay within the 'hobby gardener shares surplus harvest' category!

10.question: How can I safely share garden products?
10.answer:
üõ°Ô∏è Follow these guidelines for safely sharing garden products:

üå± HYGIENE:
‚Ä¢ Wash vegetables and fruits well
‚Ä¢ Use clean buckets/boxes
‚Ä¢ Avoid contact with soil
‚Ä¢ Keep cool until serving

üìù TRANSPARENCY:
‚Ä¢ Describe what you've grown
‚Ä¢ Mention growing method (organic/conventional)
‚Ä¢ Give storage advice
‚Ä¢ Be honest about freshness

üåø SHARING PLANTS:
‚Ä¢ Give care instructions
‚Ä¢ Mention sun/water needs
‚Ä¢ Explain how to repot
‚Ä¢ Share your experience and tips

ü§ù This way you help others and build a green community!

0.question: What features does HomeCheff have?
0.answer:
HomeCheff offers various features to improve your experience:

‚ú® STANDARD FEATURES:
‚Ä¢ Profile statistics: See total fans, favorites, reviews, rating, and views
‚Ä¢ Interactive photos: Swipe through multiple photos of products and items
‚Ä¢ Auto-slide photos: Photos automatically slide during scrolling
‚Ä¢ Favorites tab: Save and view all your favorite products in one place
‚Ä¢ Product statistics: See views, favorites, and reviews directly on product tiles
‚Ä¢ Swipe navigation: Swipe between Village Square and Inspiration pages (mobile)
‚Ä¢ Smart search function: Find what you're looking for faster with filters
‚Ä¢ User statistics: Discover popular makers via their total statistics

1.question: How do profile statistics work?
1.answer:
On each product or inspiration item, you'll see a statistics section for the maker:

üìä PROFILE STATISTICS:
‚Ä¢ Total Fans: Number of people following this maker
‚Ä¢ Total Favorites: Total number of times all items have been favorited
‚Ä¢ Total Reviews: Total number of reviews for all items
‚Ä¢ Average Rating: Average rating for all items
‚Ä¢ Total Views: Total number of views for all items

üéØ WHY USEFUL:
‚Ä¢ Discover popular makers in your neighborhood
‚Ä¢ See who's trustworthy through reviews and ratings
‚Ä¢ Follow makers with interesting content
‚Ä¢ Click on statistics to go to their profile

üí° Tip: Statistics show total figures for all items from the maker, not just this specific item.

2.question: How does the photo slider work?
2.answer:
Products and inspiration items with multiple photos have an interactive slider:

üñºÔ∏è PHOTO SLIDER:
‚Ä¢ Multiple photos: View all photos of a product on one tile
‚Ä¢ Swipe on mobile: Swipe horizontally to navigate through photos
‚Ä¢ Arrows on desktop: Use arrows to browse through photos
‚Ä¢ Auto-slide: Photos automatically slide during scrolling
‚Ä¢ Stops on interaction: Auto-slide pauses 5 seconds after your action
‚Ä¢ Hover pause: Auto-slide stops when you hover over the photo

üéØ WHY HANDY:
‚Ä¢ See all photos without opening the product
‚Ä¢ Better impression of the product before clicking
‚Ä¢ Save time by quickly scrolling through photos
‚Ä¢ Professional presentation of your products

üí° Tip: Swipe on mobile or click arrows on desktop to manually navigate through photos.

3.question: What is the Favorites tab in my profile?
3.answer:
The Favorites tab keeps all your favorite items in one central place:

‚ù§Ô∏è FAVORITES:
‚Ä¢ All favorites: See all products and items you've favorited
‚Ä¢ Quick access: Go directly to your favorite items without searching
‚Ä¢ Organization: Keep your favorite makers and products organized
‚Ä¢ Updates: Stay updated on favorite products and makers

üéØ HOW TO USE:
‚Ä¢ Click the heart on a product to favorite it
‚Ä¢ Go to your profile and click the 'Favorites' tab
‚Ä¢ View all your favorite items in one place
‚Ä¢ Click an item to go directly to the product

üí° Tip: Favorites help you quickly return to items you found interesting.

4.question: What do the statistics on product tiles mean?
4.answer:
On each product tile, you'll see important statistics:

üìà PRODUCT STATISTICS:
‚Ä¢ Views (üëÅÔ∏è): Number of times this specific product has been viewed
‚Ä¢ Favorites (‚ù§Ô∏è): Number of people who have favorited this product
‚Ä¢ Reviews (‚≠ê): Number of reviews for this specific product
‚Ä¢ Rating: Average rating for this product

üéØ DIFFERENCE FROM PROFILE STATISTICS:
‚Ä¢ Product statistics: Specific to this one product
‚Ä¢ Profile statistics: Total across all items from the maker

üí° WHY USEFUL:
‚Ä¢ See directly how popular a product is
‚Ä¢ Make better choices by viewing reviews and ratings
‚Ä¢ Discover trending products in your neighborhood
‚Ä¢ Compare products based on statistics

‚ö†Ô∏è Important: Product statistics only show figures for this specific product, not for all products from the maker.

5.question: How does swipe navigation between pages work?
5.answer:
On mobile devices, you can swipe between Village Square and Inspiration:

üì± SWIPE NAVIGATION:
‚Ä¢ Swipe left: Go from Village Square to Inspiration
‚Ä¢ Swipe right: Go from Inspiration to Village Square
‚Ä¢ Minimum 100px swipe needed to navigate
‚Ä¢ Only works on touch devices (mobile/tablet)

üéØ WHY HANDY:
‚Ä¢ Quick navigation between main pages
‚Ä¢ Intuitive mobile experience
‚Ä¢ No menu needed to switch
‚Ä¢ Efficient browsing on mobile

üí° Tip: Swipe navigation only works if you swipe horizontally. Vertical scrolling works normally.

6.question: How can I start the tour?
6.answer:
The tour helps you discover the app:

‚ú® TOUR:
‚Ä¢ Look for the 'Start tour' button on the page
‚Ä¢ The button has a ‚ú® (stars) icon
‚Ä¢ Click the button to start the tour
‚Ä¢ Follow the steps to discover all features

üéØ HOW IT WORKS:
‚Ä¢ No automatic start: Only starts when you click the button
‚Ä¢ Per page: Each page has its own tour
‚Ä¢ Skip: You can always skip the tour
‚Ä¢ Repeatable: Start the tour again whenever you want

üí° Tip: The tour doesn't start automatically - you have full control. Click 'Start tour' when you're ready to learn!

checkout.stripeCostsPassedToBuyer: Stripe costs are passed on to the buyer. HomeCheff costs are settled with the seller.

delivererSelector.islandDeliveryDesc: Deliverers only work on the same island. Distance is less important because islands are small. Deliverers are ranked based on their rating and experience.
delivererSelector.distanceDeliveryDesc: Deliverers are selected based on their location and delivery radius. Estimated time is based on total distance.

productForm.fillTitleDescriptionPrice: Please fill in title, description and valid price.

CHEFF.titlePlaceholder: E.g. Lasagne Bolognese, Tiramisu, Homemade Pizza
CHEFF.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe your dish: ingredients, preparation method, special flavors...
descriptionExamples: Fresh pasta with cream, bacon and Parmesan cheese. Traditional recipe from Rome.
Homemade cookies with dark chocolate. Perfect with coffee.
Spicy curry with fresh vegetables and coconut milk. Vegetarian and gluten-free.
futureExamples: BBQ Weekend - Extra burgers (reserve in advance)
Birthday Cake - Too big for our family

GARDEN.titlePlaceholder: E.g. Fresh Tomatoes, Herb Mix, Homegrown Strawberries
GARDEN.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe your products: growing method, season, use...
descriptionExamples: Sweet cherry tomatoes from own garden. No pesticides, 100% organic.
Fresh herb mix of basil, oregano and thyme. Perfect for Italian dishes.
Honey from own bee colony. Raw and unfiltered for maximum flavor.
futureExamples: Summer tomatoes - Reserve your portion (harvest next week)
Basil harvest - Too much for our family

DESIGNER.titlePlaceholder: E.g. Handmade Ceramics, Crocheted Blankets, Wooden Cutting Board
DESIGNER.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe your creation: material, technique, unique properties...
descriptionExamples: Unique ceramic bowl made from local clay. Each piece is handmade and unique.
Soft crocheted blanket of 100% cotton. Perfect for babies and children.
Cutting board set of durable hardwood. Finished with natural oil.

productForm.recipeInfoAutoFilled: Your recipe information has been automatically filled in. Adjust the details as desired.
productForm.addingProductFor: You are adding a product for
productForm.selectPhotosDescription: You have {total} photos. Select a maximum of {max} photos to continue.
productForm.selectAtLeastOnePhoto: Select at least 1 photo to continue
productForm.photosRequired: Add at least 1 photo before continuing
productForm.tooManyPhotos: You can add a maximum of {max} photos. Remove {count, plural, one {a photo} other {photos}} to continue
productForm.photosHelp: Add at least {min} and maximum {max} photos
productForm.maxPhotosExceeded: You can add a maximum of {max} photos
productForm.title: Title
productForm.maxStockHelp: Leave empty for unlimited stock. Must be >= current stock.
productForm.stockManagementHelp: Stock is automatically updated on orders. Leave empty for products without stock management.
productForm.currentStockHelp: Number of available items. Automatically decreased on orders.
productForm.stockMustBePositive: Current stock must be 0 or higher
productForm.stockExceedsMax: Current stock cannot be higher than maximum stock
productForm.maxStockMustBePositive: Maximum stock must be 0 or higher
productForm.stockExceedsMaxWarning: Current stock cannot be higher than maximum stock
productForm.preOrderAvailableFromDate: Pre-Order: Available from a specific date
productForm.preOrderDescription: Perfect for products that are still growing! Customers can already order and pay. The product will be available on the set harvest date.
productForm.harvestDateLabel: The date when your crop is ready for pickup/delivery
productForm.preOrderPaymentNote: The amount will be charged immediately, but the product will only be delivered/picked up on the harvest date.
productForm.customersCanOrderNow: Customers can now order and pay for this product in advance.
productForm.saveSuccess: Saved! Your item is (as public) ready for the feed.
productForm.stripeConnectRequired: You must first configure your payment details via Stripe Connect before you can post items on the village square.
productForm.paymentRequiredDescription: To sell items on the village square (with price), you must first configure your payment details via Stripe Connect. For sharing inspiration (without price), this is not necessary.

profileSettings.title: Profile Settings
profileSettings.subtitle: Manage your personal information
profileSettings.usernameCannotChange: Username cannot be changed after creation
profileSettings.quotePlaceholder: Your life motto or favorite quote...
profileSettings.quoteHint: üí≠ A short, inspiring message that others can see on your profile
profileSettings.locationHint: üåç This location is visible to other users
profileSettings.addressPrivate: üîí This information is private and is only used to calculate distances to products
profileSettings.sellerRolesDescription: Choose which seller roles you want to use on the platform
profileSettings.buyerRoleDescription: Choose 1 buyer role that best suits you
profileSettings.stripeConnectText: Payouts are securely handled via Stripe. Connect with Stripe to add your bank details.
profileSettings.encryptionDescription: Enable automatic message encryption for maximum privacy. No one, not even HomeCheff admins, can read your messages.
profileSettings.encryptionEnabledText: All your messages are automatically encrypted
profileSettings.messageGuidelinesAccepted: You have agreed to the HomeCheff message guidelines on
profileSettings.displaySettingsDescription: Choose which name is visible on your profile for other users
profileSettings.fullNameDisplayDescription: Show your full name on your profile (e.g. "John Doe")
profileSettings.firstNameDisplayDescription: Show only your first name on your profile (e.g. "John")
profileSettings.lastNameDisplayDescription: Show only your last name on your profile (e.g. "Doe")
profileSettings.usernameDisplayDescription: Show only your username on your profile (e.g. "@johndoe")
profileSettings.noNameDisplayDescription: Show no name on your profile, only username
profileSettings.privacySettingsDescription: Determine which information is visible on your public profile
profileSettings.showFansListDescription: Show your fan list and who you follow on your public profile
profileSettings.messageGuidelinesDetail1: Encrypted messages are completely private - even admins cannot read them
profileSettings.messageGuidelinesDetail2: Your account can be blocked for misuse
profileSettings.messageGuidelinesDetail3: Metadata (who, when) remains visible for moderation
profileSettings.messageGuidelinesDetail4: You are responsible for your own communication
profileSettings.acceptGuidelines: I agree to the HomeCheff message guidelines and commit to respectful, ethical communication
profileSettings.acceptGuidelinesSubtext: By accepting, you agree to the code of conduct and understand that misuse can lead to account sanctions

accountSettings.title: Account Settings
accountSettings.subtitle: Manage your account and security
accountSettings.passwordMinLength: Password must be at least 8 characters

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.description: Have a question or comment? We're here to help. Fill out the form and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.
contact.name: Name
contact.subject: Subject
contact.messagePlaceholder: Tell us how we can help you...
contact.successMessage: We've received your message and will respond as soon as possible, usually within 24 hours.
contact.errorMessage: An error occurred while sending your message. Please try again later or send an email to support@homecheff.nl

notificationSettings.title: Notification Settings
notificationSettings.subtitle: Choose which notifications you want to receive and how
notificationSettings.quietHoursDescription: üí§ Do not receive notifications during quiet hours (important security notifications will still be sent)
notificationSettings.smsNote: üí° SMS notifications are only sent for important updates
notificationSettings.newMessagesEmail: Receive an email for new chat messages
notificationSettings.newMessagesPush: Receive push notifications for new messages
notificationSettings.newOrdersEmail: Receive an email for new orders
notificationSettings.newOrdersPush: Receive push notifications for new orders
notificationSettings.orderUpdatesPush: Receive push notifications for order updates
notificationSettings.weeklyDigestEmail: Receive a weekly summary of your activity
notificationSettings.nearbyProductsPush: Receive notifications about products in your area
notificationSettings.soundEnabledDescription: Play a sound for new messages
notificationSettings.messagePreviewDescription: Show a preview of the message in notifications
notificationSettings.groupMentionsOnlyDescription: Receive notifications only for @mentions in group chats
notificationSettings.orderUpdatesSms: Receive SMS for important order updates
